titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lawrence Lee Papers, 1920-1978 SC.1978.01
titlestmt.author: Nancy Cushing.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:41:03 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Lawrence Lee was a published writer of poetry, drama, fiction and essays. At the time of his death in 1978, he was a contributing columnist to the Pittsburgh Press and had been a member of the University of Pittsburgh English Department for 31 years. The Lee papers include manuscripts, clippings, and personal correspondence, as well as copies of published books and magazine articles written by Lee, autographed editions by other contemporary authors, and association copies.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Lawrence Lee, professor emeritus of the University of Pittsburgh, was a published writer of poetry, drama, fiction and essays. Born in 1903 in Gadsden, Alabama, Lee was best known for his lyrical poetry. Notable publications include Lee's poetry on the life of Thomas Jefferson in Monticello and Other Poems (1937) and The Tomb of Thomas Jefferson and Other Poems (1940). Other notable publications include Lee's Pittsburgh pieces: Prometheus in Pittsburgh (1952), The American as Faust (1965), and "The Cathedral" (1966). Lee worked variously as an editor, instructor, and contributor to literary journals and newspapers. Lee was editor of the Virginia Quarterly Review from 1938-42, and contributed to publications such as The Sewanee Review, The Georgia Review, The Michigan Quarterly Review, The Lyric, and The Classical World. He was an instructor in English, French, and literature at various universities. The largest part of his teaching career was spent at the University of Pittsburgh. At the time of his death on October 4, 1978, he was a contributing columnist to the Pittsburgh Press and had been a member of the University of Pittsburgh English Department for 31 years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Lawrence Lee Papers consist primarily of manuscripts and typescripts of Lee's works, as well as correspondence, newspaper clippings, and books related to Lee's writing and teaching work. The collection includes multiple draft versions of Lee's writings, including a range of holograph notebooks and corrected typescripts. Lee's correspondence includes exchanges with editors and contemporary writers. Audio recordings of selected Lee works are included, as well as a small number of photographs and non-textual items, such as award plaques and graduation regalia. A small number of personal papers related to Lee's teaching career, home, and graduate coursework is also included.

Books from Lee's personal collection are shelved with the manuscripts and include a range of annotated volumes, presentation copies, and rare books. A full inventory of books and journals donated with Lee's collection is available in the Special Collections Department.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into three series:

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: The Lee collection includes both newspaper clippings and a small number of journals and newspapers. Lee's newspaper clippings have been photocopied for preservation purposes and include citation information. Originals have not been retained. For journals or newspapers containing Lee writings, pages containing his work have been photocopied for the collection (see Series I: Subseries 7), along with citation information. A complete inventory of books and journals donated with the collection is available in the Special Collections Department.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics & Technical Requirements
phystech.p: In addition to paper materials, the Lee collection also includes 13 audio reels and one cassette tape recording readings and performances of Lee's works. Please see Special Collections staff for more information on how to listen to this material.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Lawrence Lee Papers, 1920-1978, SC.1978.01, Special Collections Department, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lawrence Lee Papers, 1920-1978, SC.1978.01, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Tara Bascom in 2010 and Nancy Cushing in 2011.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Lawrence Lee's family in 1978.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series consists of typescript and manuscript drafts of Lee's poetry, prose, drama, essays and lectures ranging from 1925 through 1978. The series also includes newspaper clippings and reviews of Lee by other authors. The collection includes 13 audio reels and one audio cassette. Audio material records Lee reading his poetry as well as a performance of his dramatic poem, "The American as Faust." Correspondence accompanying Lee's manuscripts has been kept with the title to which it refers; for additional, general correspondence, see Series II.
The series is arranged into seven subseries by genre: Poetry, Prose, Drama, Press, Literary Essays and Lectures, and Audio Recordings. Subseries are arranged by title and chronology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of typescript and manuscript drafts of Lee's poetry. Correspondence accompanying Lee's manuscripts has been kept with the title to which it refers; for additional, general correspondence, see Series II. The subseries is arranged chronologically and by title, with undated material at the end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes 13 audio reels and one audio cassette. Audio material records Lee reading his poetry as well as a performance of his dramatic poem, "The American as Faust." The subseries is arranged chronologically and by title, with undated material at the end. If you intend to use these audio materials, please contact the staff at the Special Collections Department prior to your visit to see if the proper equipment is available.

did.unittitle: Lawrence Lee Reading from His Poetry

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains preservation copies from the journals and compilations that Lee donated with his papers. Photocopies have been made of the articles, poems, and other writings by Lee, as well as reviews of Lee's work, that were contained in these publications. See Special Collections for a full list of donated journals and books, including Lee's monographs and annotated or signed copies of other authors' works. The subseries is arranged chronologically and by title, with undated material at the end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series II contains personal and professional correspondence from 1924 through 1978. The series includes correspondence with editors, publishers, and other writers of the period. The bulk of the material consists of correspondence with Dr. J.S. Wilson and Ralph Buchsbaum. The collection also includes letters from major figures such as Robert Frost, Sherwood Anderson, F. Scott Fitzgerald. The series is arranged alphabetically, by agency or author's last name. Additional correspondence, kept by Lee alongside specific manuscripts, is located in Series I.

did.unittitle: List of Letters Owned by L. Lee
Frost, Robert (with TS poem, The Silken Tent)
Posvar, Wesley (Chancellor, University of Pittsburgh) and Powers, David

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series III contains miscellaneous personal material ranging from 1920 through 1978. Includes material ranging from C.V. information to lecture notes for courses taken at Harvard and teaching notes for courses taught at the University of Pittsburgh. The series also includes a record book of Lee's distribution of author copies, materials related to Lee's home in Pittsburgh, and graduation regalia. Also includes a scrapbook containing photographs, news clippings, manuscript poems, and correspondence. Series is arranged chronologically, with undated material at the end.
